body: I'll support this. Definitely makes sense to support turning off indentation enforcement in this area for consistency.

Unfortunately, it looks like there wasn't enough interest from the team
or community to implement this change. While we wish we'd be able to
accommodate everyone's requests, we do need to prioritize. We've found
that issues failing to reach accepted status after 21 days tend to
never be accepted, and as such, we [close those issues](https://eslint.org/docs/maintainer-guide/issues#when-to-close-an-issue).
This doesn't mean the idea isn't interesting or useful, just that it's
not something the team can commit to.

Thanks for contributing to ESLint and we appreciate your understanding.

[//]: # (auto-close)

What does it take for an issue to *"reach accepted status"*? Can I do something to help (except implementing the change, which I can't do right now sadly)?

Do you know any steps I can take, @platinumazure? Thanks for looking and sorry to bother.

@papb No worries. It looks like this just completely skipped through the cracks. I can ask some team members to see if this might be worth reopening and accepting.

As for our process for accepting issues: Please see [here](https://eslint.org/docs/maintainer-guide/issues#accepting-issues) for more details. Basically, we would need someone to champion the rule, and 3 others on the team to give it a :+1: and nobody to give it :-1:. I gave :+1:, but we had no champion and no other :+1:. I could potentially see myself championing this, but I don't have time to look into that just yet.

@platinumazure - Thanks for looking into it :grimacing: I really appreciate it.

And thanks for the info as well :)

Reopening for one more evaluation attempt (will close in a week or so if I can't get support).

I'll champion this.
@platinumazure Looks like it might be time to close this. Are you still championing this proposal?

It's unfortunate, but if no one else is interested, I guess it makes sense to close :frowning_face: 

I still don't have the time, but, question: assuming I have the time to create a PR for this, what would be the chances of it being accepted? Thanks

Don't get sad, the thumbs up in your initial message shows more people is interested, and count me on that as well.

ESLint team, please make this happen :)
@diegocr Ah, thanks!! :smiley: I hadn't noticed the reactions to my first post!
